comments.body:
```suggestion
final case class TemplateConfig(moduleName: String, entityName: String) extends Ordered[TemplateConfig]
```

When possible I prefer to use `scala.math.Ordered` over `scala.math.Ordering`.

See  [`scala.math.Ordering`](https://www.scala-lang.org/api/2.12.3/scala/math/Ordering.html)
> this trait and scala.math.Ordered both provide this same functionality, but in different ways. A type T can be given a single way to order itself by extending Ordered. Using Ordering, this same type may be sorted in many other ways.
